sen.e: However, the appointment to the post in bakufu came to be decided in consideretion of not only Chigyo daka (a stipend in terms of rice production of the fief) but also a functional skil of the person, and when an excellent Shogun's retainer was chosen and installed in the important post, there were cases that he could not pay for the expense burden accompanied with the post by his Chigyo daka and rather than became poor.

sen.j: 元禄5年（1692年）から享保7年（1722年）までの30年間に在任した幕府役職者のうち、大目付・町奉行・勘定奉行就任者の79％、大番頭就任者の29％が役料支給の対象となった。
sen.e: Among the officials of bakufu who were in office during thirty years from 1692 to 1722, 79 % of officials who took office in ometsuke, machi bugyo and kanjo bugyo, and 29 % of them who took office in oban gashira were subjected to the payment of yakuryo.

sen.j: 慶応3年9月26日 (旧暦)（1867年10月23日）に幕府財政の金銀中心への移行に伴い、布衣以上の足高・役料・役扶持などを廃止して役金に統一するが、同年の大政奉還によって実際に機能する前に廃止されることになった。
sen.e: Accompanied with a shift to gold-and-silver-oriented financial affairs of bakufu, in October 23, 1867, tashidaka, yakuryo, and yakufuchi (salary for the post) more that hoi (traditional everyday clothes) were abolished and unified into yakukin (monthly salary according to the status), however, yakukin was abolished before actually functioned because of Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) of that year.
